Title: the re entry minimization

Scene: The Soyuz Capsule. Howard is screaming.
Later. Penny and Sheldon have their foreheads on light sabres and are spinning.
Raj: Howard’s capsule should be re-entering the atmosphere any minute.
We’re not kicking him out. Stuart and I have become good friends.
Okay, the NASA Web site says Howard’s final descent has begun.
Oh, my God, you’re back. Oh, look at you. You, you look like you grew.
Oh, uh, come in, come in. Oh, I, uh, I didn’t think I was going to get to see you until tomorrow.
Wait, your, your mother is sleeping with your dentist?
So you’re wandering all around by yourself? That’s not the kind of hero’s welcome an astronaut should come home to.
Just until he gets back on his feet, which are looking pretty good in the boots I bought him for his birthday.
Oh, yeah, we hang out all the time.
It’s like we both had these holes in our lives, but now we fill each other’s holes.
Oh, Howard, it’s still our thing. Come with us, we’ll, we’ll get you a scalped ticket.
We’ll switch. You’ll come sit with me after intermission.
Okay, uh, will I get to see you tomorrow?
Leonard: It’ll be good to have him back.
I don’t have a problem with Stuart. Besides, he gives us a twenty percent discount at his comic book store.
All right, Pictionary. What are the teams?
Batman. Batman and Robin. Uh, Wonder Twins plus the monkey. Wonder Twins plus the monkey and Batman.
In what universe is that a present?
No.
Nothing with quarks.
No.
How could you miss that?
Penny got it.
Oh, uh, uh, uh, sausage. Uh, uh, uh, uh, bratwurst? Oh, oh, a hot dog.
A solar system. Uh, uh, uh, uh, um, unidentified flying liverwurst? I don’t…
I don’t know, uh, Casper the alcoholic ghost?
Mmm, in all fairness, Pictionary has verbal skills, visual skills. It’s a pretty well-rounded game.
En el acelerador de particulares.
Just pick another game.
No good, Sheldon doesn’t float.
Yeah, that’s when it started.
Uh-uh.
I’m trying. Don’t yell at me.
I know what he looks like.
Because he’s hard to find. If he was easy to find, the books would be called There’s Waldo.
57, 58, 59, that’s one minute.
Remember, show your work.
Get up, we can’t lose at math.
So?
Sheldon, we haven’t won a game all night. Now, you either stick your face in that pie or I’m gonna stick that pie in your face.
Snort it down and keep eating!
Sheldon: Yeah, you had a good run, Fake Wolowitz. We’ll remember you with nostalgic fondness, the way we do the dial-up modem, the VHS tape, or, or Leonard’s gym membership.
Okay, one vote for, one vote against. Leonard, you’re the tiebreaker.
Well, I don’t sell my friendship that cheaply.
Welcome aboard, old chum.
He left a boy, he returns a boy-sized hero.
You know, I am very disappointed that I won’t be able to celebrate Howard’s accomplishment tonight.
Yes, it’s just that in all the years I’ve known him, he’s never had the opportunity to receive my admiration. I was excited to see the look on his face when it finally happened.
I know.
Oh, that hardly seems fair. But I guess any team that I’m not on has a decided disadvantage.
Yeah, once again, I know.
Got it.
Oh, Leonard. Now, how can you not get that?
It’s not a present, it’s the present. Look. There’s you and me. There’s Penny and Amy. We’re playing Pictionary. In the present.
It’s a quark-gluon plasma.
It’s asymptotically free partons inside a quark-gluon plasma.
It’s an observational rebuttal of the Lambda-CDM model of the universe.
Hey, if you want someone to guess chocolate chip cookie, you draw a glass of milk next to it.
Yeah, only after I eliminated all the obvious answers. You’re welcome.
There.
Come on, Leonard, I am spoon-feeding this to you.

Wait, no, no. No. The word is Polish. See, look. Polish sausage. And the, the model of the solar system developed by Nicolaus Copernicus, a Polish astronomer. And then, finally, if that wasn’t enough, which it should have been, this is Madame Curie killing herself by discovering radium, who, although she was a naturalized French citizen, was Polish by birth.
Ah. So it is. I guess we both share blame on this one.
Don’t know.
I am not a loser. Pictionary is not a true test of any real intelligence or skill.
Lot of big talk from a man who can’t draw a chocolate chip cookie.
All right. Let’s play Physics Fiesta.
It’s a game that I just invented, in which the participants answer physics questions in remedial Spanish. Um, ¿Dónde está el boson de Higgs?
Bueno, mi amigo.
All games are made up. They’re not found in nature. You don’t just dig in the ground, come across a rich vein of Rock’em Sock’em Robots.
That is true. I have a higher than normal body density. If I run too deep a bath, I drown.
No, that’s not fair either.
Darts is a bar game. You’ve been frequenting drinking establishments since you were of legal age.
Well, regardless, she has a distinct advantage in all tavern-based competitions. Pool, beer pong, wet T-shirt contests, they’re all out.
No.
Hurry up, find him, find him.
For goodness’ sake, he’s wearing a hat, glasses, and a red striped shirt.
How could you not find him?
I’m okay. I’m okay. I’m not okay.
Stop that.
Amy, do something. Amy, help. Amy, stop that. Amy, Penny, both of you, stop it.
Wait. I’m a little concerned. Blueberries are rich in antioxidants.
So, with all those antioxidants, what if I run out of oxidants?
That’s rude.
Oh, ow, blueberry in my nose, blueberry in my nose!
Stuart: I, I kind of live here now.
Ah, he’s spoiling me and I love it.
Plus, he doesn’t have a girlfriend, I don’t have a girlfriend.
Uh, that sounds a little funny to an American ear.
Raj is taking me to the Sound of Music sing-along.
So I, I, I’d be sitting by myself during Edelweiss?
Mike: That was just the parachute. We still have another six miles to go. (Howard screams again)
Howard: The Jewish prayer for eating bread! We don’t have one for falling out of space! We did it! We’re on the ground! We survived!
Whoa, thank you. Great to be back on Earth.
I missed you, too. Where are the guys?
Oh, I get it. They’re waiting back home with a big surprise party. Don’t worry, I can act surprised. (Does)
Gesundheit. You okay?
Great. Just keep in mind astronauts lose a lot of muscle tone in space, so you might have to do most of the heavy lifting.
Bernie, you okay?
Did you get a sea lion while I was gone?
Okay.
Oh. Are you kidding? Every minute of every…
Sweetie, we don’t have to do this now.
You okay?
Okay.
Bernadette? Bernie? Bernie?
Well, that was quick, and a little gross. Now, I know how she feels.
Hey, Ma, twinkle, twinkle, your little star is home. Ma, the chain’s on the door.
Yeah, well, Bernie’s not feeling well, so I thought I’d stop by, tell you about the greatest adventure of my life, see if you can make me feel bad about it.
All right. Woman hasn’t tied her robe in 20 years. Suddenly she’s not decent?
Ma, who is in there?
Who is that?
If you’re busy, I can come back.
What are you doing here?
You’re a dentist.
One to beam aboard?
Yeah. The lack of gravity did decompress my spine, so I’m like an inch and a half taller. I’m going to the DMV tomorrow to get my license changed before I shrink back.
Yeah, well, Bernadette’s a little under the weather and my mom’s kind of under my dentist.
Former dentist. I need a new one now that I know where his hands have been.
It’s okay, you know, we space cowboys don’t do what we do for glory and fame. We leave that to your rock stars and your athletes and your Howie Mandels.
Oh, Stuart, thanks. What are you doing here?
Wow, so you guys are like buds now?
Okay, so what do you guys got going on tonight?
Sound of Music sing-along? That used to be our thing, but that’s cool.
So I’d be sitting by myself?
No, no, you guys go. Have fun.
Absolutely. See you, Stuart.
At least my mother made her boyfriend climb out the window.
Hey, guys, guess who’s back from space.
I don’t think so.
Yes. Yes, I am.
Oh, thank you so much. I’ve been having the worst night. I just got back, and my friends don’t care, my wife’s sick, I went to my mom…

Yes, please. (Sings) And I think it’s gonna be long, long time till touchdown brings me ’round again to find I’m not the man they think I am at home, oh, no, oh, no, I’m a rocket man. (Sneezes) Perfect.
Bernadette: He’s coming back from outer space.
No, I mean, he… Never mind. There he is! Howie!
No, I told them they could have you tomorrow night. Tonight, you belong to me. (Sneezes)
I am now that you’re back. Come on, let’s go home so I can tear off those little pants.
Took some Benadryl. I’ll be fine. So, did you miss me?
Yes, we do. You left right after we got married. This is like our honeymoon. Now, hold on to your hat. Oh. Uh-oh.
A little dizzy. Must be the Benadryl. Switch places with me.
Now, kiss me. (He does. She starts snoring)
Man in Suit: I think this flight’s coming from Houston.
Howie Mandel: Uh, I think they’re here for me, Ringo.
Oh, thanks. That nut job was telling everybody on the plane he’s an astronaut.
Amy: Me, too. But we’ll see him tomorrow.
Penny, aren’t you gonna draw something?
Why don’t we do something athletic like go over to the university pool and play water polo?
All right, let’s keep it simple. How about darts?
We could go to the cadaver lab at UCLA and play real-life Operation.
Are you sure? I mean, the nose doesn’t light up, but if the corpse is fresh enough, sometimes you can get the leg to jerk.
Oh, there he is, I got him.
Long division, long division. Go, go, go.
Ready, set, wrestle. (Penny pins Sheldon straight away) One, two, three, pin.
On the count of three. One, two…
Penny: Oh, my God, we’re gonna kill them.
Relax, we got time, this is so fun.
Excuse me, the word is polish. See? Small P.
Hey, Sheldon, you’re always full of fun little facts. Where did the expression got your ass handed to you come from?
I wonder if it’s from, like, ancient Rome where they’d actually chop somebody’s ass off and then go, here. You know, to appease Loseroneous, the god of losers.
All right, fine, pick another game. Amy and I will beat you at anything.
Oh, come on, what is that?
No, no, we’re not playing some dumb made-up game.
Okay. Just for the record, I have never entered a wet T-shirt contest. I’ve won a few, but that’s just because I spill when I’m drunk, so…
All right, standard state fair pie-eating contest rules are, no hands, first one to clean the pan wins.
Dr Schneider: Yes, yes, I am. I think he’s on to us.
Waitress: Yeah, I just saw you on the news. You’re an astronaut.
Good for you. How about a piece of cheesecake on the house?
You want the cheesecake or not?
